text:
Hi all,
Can we create a theme using React in HubSpot?
If yes, could you please share the documentation of react theme?
Thanks in advance!
It is possible, but there is no documentation about it. Following link is about the use of frameworks: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/js-frameworks#reactjs>
Got it, Thanks <@U04L48G23T6>

Hey, you need a theme with a blog template included. Blog listing pages are now fully drag-n-drop, but a blog post page is still limited. You have the base template and can drag/drop into the content area of the blog post.

Once you have your theme in place, go to the website settings area, then blog. You can assign both a listing and post template to your blog. This will automatically apply to all of the posts in the blog. Then you can go the new listing page and edit as needed.
Hey Nathan thanks for the response. My problem is that only my blog template is available when I go in to change them and not the Listing template.
I have a new theme fully created and all the other pages are working great. Something about changing the blog listing is just giving me trouble

If you have the meetings functionality in your HubSpot portal, you can setup custom links like this that people can use to setup meetings with you. Then you can sync it to your Outlook or Google calendar so it pulls your availability.

Your theme should have two blog templates... a listing template and a post template. The listing one should contain this:

templateType: blog_listing

yup in the listing I have

`<!--`
`templateType: blog_listing`
`isAvailableForNewContent: true`
`label: Blog Listing`
`-->`

and in the single I have

`<!--`
  `templateType: blog_post`
  `isAvailableForNewContent: true`
  `label: Blog Post`
`-->`
I may just need to reach out to support. I've been trying to figure this one out for a few days now.

Try going to the listing page, click the HubSpot toolbar in the top corner and click "Edit Page". It will look like editing a regular content page. Click the Settings tab and scroll down and open advanced settings. You'll see the assigned template there with the ability to change it. Try swapping the template from there.
Currently the best option looks like using this API:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/get-the-details-for-a-marketing-email>
to get the email and then use something like nodemailer to send the email as a transactional email. And just BCC the HubSpot email address for email tracking
<@UATE4ATHP> any chance you are able to help us locate this in the coding to fix the error? I'm having trouble finding where to find the CSS is hiding it. Thanks!
Ooh that's an idea! :bulb:
William_Mills_WM_May2018-style.css
But it could be in another file loaded in that one
is there a way to set `HubSpotutk` on a page from a tracked 1:1 link?
Hi all, what is the best way to prevent HubSpot tracking on a particular page? What do I need to do?
Use GTM and in the trigger for that HS tag, specify the page you don’t want to track.
Hi I’ve been googling around and I’m guessing the answer is ‘no’ but who out there is developing on an iPad?
thank you
Hi, do you know if there any discounts for HubSpot Inbound for dev partners?
